intro: Hyalosema micholitzii, commonly known as the Micholitz's hyalosema, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that resemble those of other members of its family. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Hyalosema micholitzii is native to specific regions in South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
